area_name: L Wall (aka part of M Face)

content.description: Get on this, and get it! You’ll sweat, and you'll work up a smile. I’d say the crux is figuring out how to get started and then finding direction for the second move. Move left or move right? I got lucky by having a friend who was like, “what you’re doing doesn’t look good or effective. Try something else”. Once I got going, I found this to be climbable and totally fun.
content.protection: I built a TR anchor off a 60’ rope doubled over on itself for redundancy and anchored to a boulder further up the slope with a super long sling.
content.location: The narrow face where L Wall meets K Wall hosts two climbs. Thunderstorm 5.10 is on the left side of the face and shares the corner with K Wall. Static Cling 5.10- is on the right side of that skinny face.

pathTokens: L Wall (aka part of M Face)

content.description: This is the right part of the former M Face. This used to be quite difficult to access. Now 200 ft of dirt helps...one big starter pile.L->R:A. Thunderstorm, 8.B. Static Cling, 10-, 1p, 18', TR.C. Easy Vee, 10-.D. Petty Larceny, V4.E. Flying Dutchman, A3 or V?
